javafe
Class FrontEndTool

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--javafe.Tool
        |
        +--javafe.FrontEndTool
Direct Known Subclasses:
CopyLoaded, PrintSpec, SrcTool
public abstract class FrontEndTool
extends Tool

FrontEndTool is an abstract class for tools that use our Java front end.

It handles parsing the standard options for setting up the front end and initializing the front end using those options. At the end of a run, it prints a count of how many cautions, warnings, and errors occurred (cf. ErrorSet). It also handles catching FatalErrors (see ErrorSet.fatal). The remaining processing, if any, is front-end-tool specific.

Field Detail

noCautions

public static boolean noCautions
option to turn off caution warnings. This is used for houdini where it is a pain to weed out the cautions from code where we are looking only at warnings.

showNonOptions

public abstract void showNonOptions()
Print non-option usage info to System.err. Output must include at least one newline.

showOptions

public void showOptions()
Print option information to System.err. Each printed line should be preceeded by two blank spaces.

Each overriding method should first call super.showOptions().

processOption

public int processOption(java.lang.String option,
                         java.lang.String[] args,
                         int offset)
Process next tool option.

See Tool.processOption for the complete specification of this routine.

This routine handles the standard front-end options, storing the resulting information in the preceding instance variables and Info.on.

Overrides:
processOption in class Tool

setup

public void setup()
Setup: initialize the front end using the standard front-end-tool option variables (userPath, sysPath).

This can be done only once. The standard front-end-tool option variables have no effect after this point. May exit with an error (via ErrorSet.fatal).

Ensures OutsideEnv has been properly initialized (except if an error occurs).

Also initializes PrettyPrint.inst and TypeCheck.inst to their default front end values.

makeStandardTypeReader

public StandardTypeReader makeStandardTypeReader(java.lang.String path,
                                                 PragmaParser P)
Called to obtain the StandardTypeReader to be used for locating and reading in types.

makePragmaParser

public PragmaParser makePragmaParser()
Called to obtain the pragma parser to be used for parsing input files. If null is returned, then no pragma parsing is done. (By default, returns null).

makePrettyPrint

public PrettyPrint makePrettyPrint()
Called to obtain the pretty printer to set PrettyPrint.inst to. May not return null. By default, returns javafe.ast.StandardPrettyPrint.

makeTypeCheck

public TypeCheck makeTypeCheck()
Called to obtain an instance of the javafe.tc.TypeCheck class (or a subclass thereof). May not return null. By default, returns javafe.tc.TypeCheck.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Start up an instance of this tool using command-line arguments args.

Note: this code needs to be copied verbatim to each subclass of Tool except with the name of the actual subclass inserted after the new operator and the comment characters (//) removed.

(This needs to be done because static methods cannot be inherited.)

frontEndToolProcessing

public abstract void frontEndToolProcessing(java.lang.String[] args,
                                            int offset)
Perform any front-end-tool-specific processing.

The remaining arguments are args[offset], args[offset+1], ...
